title: Can we have more information about this guy?
body:
(EDIT: I did a champion concept for him here: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/tX0BKyiy-x-141-the-vigil-naut)
http://www.cgmeetup.net/home/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/League-of-Legends-Ekko-Seconds-6.jpg
I absolutely love this dude. it was first shown in the Ekko trailer: Seconds.
He is basically like a giant Frankenstein monster with some cyborg things going on. (Or Hitler on steroids don't know)

Even if he share a similar theme goin on with Urgot, i think this dude's design is enough original to be his own thing in the game.
I'm pretty sure he is from Zaun since that's the plae where all these things going on, and it would be absolutely great to see him like this badass Juggernaut from Zaun steamrolling through everything.

You could say it would be kinda like a Sion clone, but Sion is more of a full tank, and we do not have any Juggernaut from Zaun.
He just look too fking cool, just work on him please

What does Jhin bring to this game?
If you read, Jhin is the mad artist. You even have it quoted

And what does it bring to this game? And what does it have to do with his kit? When you create a champion, you can't just say "heh he's this thing" without reasoning. By this logic, Fiora is an artist as well, because she has a joke for that. Jhin sounds like a guy who didn't make it to the theater and now he's so upset that he just grabbed his uncle's gun and went on rampage. Not to mention that his overall persona is a "V for Vendetta/Joker" edgelord kind of thing. At least he doesn't quote Vaas from Far Cry 3, because I would delete this game instantly.

Have you even listened to his quotes? All about theater. One of his abilities: captive audience, curtain call. His kit isn't the best, but he is a mercenary that has a theater mentality. honestly. It feels like you don't know anything about this champ. He _looks_ v for vendetta, but is more of plain theater theme mercenary.

Right, I've said in my post that:
>Jhin sounds like a guy who didn't make it to the theater and now he's so upset that he just grabbed his uncle's gun and went on rampage.

So is my statement still true? Yup.

Um, no. He technically made it into the theater. Everyone he is hired to kill, their deaths are a "performance". He's in showbizz, but in his own way. He sees death as a grand finale. There are no rampages. He gets hired, kills the person, sees it as a performance. Check and mate.
